root.text:
FYI, we just migrated NMPS (which returns SKUs for the given calories) to the new cluster on *staging*.
There shouldn't be any issue your side, but if you something is broken, please ping me :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: FYI, we just migrated NMPS (which returns SKUs for the given calories) to the new cluster on
staging

.
There shouldn't be any issue your side, but if you something is broken, please ping me

messages.text:
We completely migrated NMPS to FTCP.

On staging, we don't even have the app on the legacy cluster anymore and everything goes directly to the FTCP

For live, We are serving 100% of the traffic from FTCP, but we still have the apps running on the legacy cluster as well, so we can switch back in case of something goes wrong. I'll remove the app from the legacy cluster for live, early next week :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text:

For live, We are serving 100% of the traffic from FTCP, but we still have the apps running on the legacy cluster as well, so we can switch back in case of something goes wrong. I'll remove the app from the legacy cluster for live, early next week

<@US74TEQ3E>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `Changing multi-pet voucher code`
*Topic:* `Ad-hoc request (copy update, enabling/disabling feature, etc.)`
*Details:* `We're currently running a 20% discount for multi-pet which is CVA negative. As a result, we'd like to revert back to the 30% discount. Can we please update the multi-pet voucher code to MULTIPET6 on Monday, 8/11?`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question
attachments.text:
<@US74TEQ3E>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `Changing multi-pet voucher code`
*Topic:* `Ad-hoc request (copy update, enabling/disabling feature, etc.)`
*Details:* `We're currently running a 20% discount for multi-pet which is CVA negative. As a result, we'd like to revert back to the 30% discount. Can we please update the multi-pet voucher code to MULTIPET6 on Monday, 8/11?`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question

_thread_replies.text: cc <@U03UMPD2NNS> <@U05HHDYS65N>

elements.text: cc

_thread_replies.text:
:sparkles: *Automatic Answer:* 
To update the multi-pet voucher code to MULTIPET6 on Monday, 8/11:

1. Locate the current voucher code configuration in your system
2. Replace the existing code with `MULTIPET6`
3. Set the discount value to 30%
4. Schedule the change to take effect on Monday, 8/11
5. Ensure the new code is properly linked to the multi-pet discount program
6. Test the new code before the scheduled change to verify it applies the correct 30% discount

*Remember to communicate this change to relevant teams*, including customer service and marketing, so they can update their materials accordingly.
 *Additional sources:*
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/CQQNMEPK2/p1740767320209079?thread_ts=1740767320.209079&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] Voucher Code not working as expected >
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/CQQNMEPK2/p1692015950997339?thread_ts=1692015950.997339&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] The Pets Table US Campaign Discount Setting Change> :warning:_This answer was generated based on the available documentation mentioned above, proceed with caution._

Does this resolve your query, <@US74TEQ3E>? Unified Search :mag: button

text.text:
:sparkles: *Automatic Answer:* 
To update the multi-pet voucher code to MULTIPET6 on Monday, 8/11:

1. Locate the current voucher code configuration in your system
2. Replace the existing code with `MULTIPET6`
3. Set the discount value to 30%
4. Schedule the change to take effect on Monday, 8/11
5. Ensure the new code is properly linked to the multi-pet discount program
6. Test the new code before the scheduled change to verify it applies the correct 30% discount

*Remember to communicate this change to relevant teams*, including customer service and marketing, so they can update their materials accordingly.

*Additional sources:*
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/CQQNMEPK2/p1740767320209079?thread_ts=1740767320.209079&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] Voucher Code not working as expected >

5992598 - KN-MX-1-300-0, meal selection 3

the first two customers used to be on a different plan type and this is their first time with mixed

I will be changing all 3 meal selections manually right now so they can receive a box`

*Actual behaviour:* `invalid meal selections`

_thread_replies.text: <!subteam^S05K3MZSD55>
for the trial one especially, can we see any indicators of what they meant to order? I need to change it to something valid in the next 3 hours

elements.text: for the trial one especially, can we see any indicators of what they meant to order? I need to change it to something valid in the next 3 hours

_thread_replies.text:
For Customer: <https://bob.thepetstable.com/customer-ext/edit_index/index/id_customer/5992598|5992598> - Subscription: 2999009 - SKU: KN-MX-1-300-0 - Meal Index: `16`
For Customer: <https://bob.thepetstable.com/customer-ext/edit_index/index/id_customer/5921898|5921898> - Subscription: 2978612 - SKU: KN-MX-1-450-0 - Meal Index: `35`
For Customer: <https://bob.thepetstable.com/customer-ext/edit_index/index/id_customer/6322935|6322935> - Subscription: 3102842 - SKU: KN-TDR-1-1450-0 - Meal Index:  `11` . This customer has another trial box coming for a different subscription (3106337) which has the SKU mentioned on the request (KN-TDR-1-1250-0) with the meal selection `13` and it is a valid meal selection for DRY plan, which created a confusion/delay

Derived these meal indices from bob entries where the invalid selection being set (attached those as screenshots for reference)

attachments.fallback:
<@U8F7ZDAPM>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question. Please check the details.
*Question title:* `Need help debugging unusual behaviour `
*Topic:* `Kafka Recurring Selection Service`
*Details:* `Hey team, we've noticed some strange behaviour happening with some users' meal selections. We're still investigating so we don't have all the info atm but what we think is happening is some users who change their plan + select new meals have their selection overwritten at some point with the old meal selection.

We've been digging into the MSS and KRS logs and have seen some unusual behaviour that makes us think this might be a BE issue but we need help debugging it to make sure. If it's fine with you we will schedule a session to pair on this today`
*Category:* squad-new-ventures-systems
*Command:* new-ventures-systems-question
attachments.text:
<@U8F7ZDAPM>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question. Please check the details.
*Question title:* `Need help debugging unusual behaviour `
*Topic:* `Kafka Recurring Selection Service`

We're still investigating so we don't have all the info atm but what we think is happening is some users who change their plan + select new meals have their selection overwritten at some point with the old meal selection.

We've been digging into the MSS and KRS logs and have seen some unusual behaviour that makes us think this might be a BE issue but we need help debugging it to make sure. If it's fine with you we will schedule a session to pair on this today`
*Category:* squad-new-ventures-systems
*Command:* new-ventures-systems-question

_thread_replies.text: Pls keep me in the loop on this - thanks

elements.text: Pls keep me in the loop on this - thanks

_thread_replies.text:
We don't think it's happening for all the subscriptions, as we couldn't reproduce this issue for two of our test subscriptions on live `3099052` (plan changed from dry to mix) and `3007038` (plan changed from fresh to mix). Both subscriptions meal choices didn't get overwritten like we have seen on the reported subscriptions. Which eventually making this issue harder to debug.

Currently we are still working on identifying the specific root cause by extending some monitoring setup around the change-plan logic on the FrontEnd and also continuing the discussion with the BackEnd teams to understand this weird system behavior. We have already started looking into the impact of this issue as well, will update you once we have the data.

elements.text: We don't think it's happening for all the subscriptions, as we couldn't reproduce this issue for two of our test subscriptions on live
(plan changed from dry to mix) and

(plan changed from fresh to mix). Both subscriptions meal choices didn't get overwritten like we have seen on the reported subscriptions. Which eventually making this issue harder to debug.

Currently we are still working on identifying the specific root cause by extending some monitoring setup around the change-plan logic on the FrontEnd and also continuing the discussion with the BackEnd teams to understand this weird system behavior. We have already started looking into the impact of this issue as well, will update you once we have the data.

_thread_replies.text:
Update: Based on the investigation so far we have identified two cases which are potentially creating these issues
 on FrontEnd, when the user goes through the change plan flow,  incorrect delivery week being used to trigger the recurring meal selection in some edge cases (based on delivery options available for the current plan vs the new plan). eg., W36 used instead of W35. In these cases users will end up getting wrong meal selection, when rescheduling the delivery to W35 after changing the plan
 on Backend, there is a redundant selection event is fired in few cases, when a subscription's delivery entering the post-cut off state and this event overrides the meal-selection with a wrong value.
Fixes have been deployed for both these cases on Monday, and we are expecting a reduction in number of such cases going further.

elements.text: Update: Based on the investigation so far we have identified two cases which are potentially creating these issues

on FrontEnd, when the user goes through the change plan flow,  incorrect delivery week being used to trigger the recurring meal selection in some edge cases (based on delivery options available for the current plan vs the new plan). eg., W36 used instead of W35. In these cases users will end up getting wrong meal selection, when rescheduling the delivery to W35 after changing the plan
on Backend, there is a redundant selection event is fired in few cases, when a subscription's delivery entering the post-cut off state and this event overrides the meal-selection with a wrong value.
Fixes have been deployed for both these cases on Monday, and we are expecting a reduction in number of such cases going further.

_thread_replies.text: thanks for the follow up, Guhan. We will monitor starting Monday if we see these continued issues. So far this week we haven't seen them
